discussion.content:
To Do description:
Microsoft To Do
To Do is an intelligent task management app that makes it easy to plan and manage your day. Access To Do across devices including iOS, Android, Windows, and the web. Whether you need to complete a task for work, school or home, To Do empowers you to complete the most important things you need to get done, every day.

Focus and achieve your most important tasks with a daily to-do list called "My Day."
Utilize smart suggestions to add tasks, upcoming or overdue tasks.
Share lists and assign tasks with colleagues, friends, and family.
Break down more complex tasks into subtasks.
Schedule reminders and repeatable tasks.
Sync your tasks across Outlook, Teams and Planner, and generate tasks from flagged Outlook emails.

3rd could be to do with "assign and share tasks with colleagues"

C: ToDo does not manage resources. Project plan5 needs for that anyway. 
In other hand it is said Booking is good for appointments and calendar but not. Outlook Calendar is much better in my opinion.
was in exam june15,2023

Bookings
Planner
The word "Prioritize" makes you wonder!! I am going TO DO with the third one.
Can To-Do manage resource?

2nd one is To Do or Microsoft Project. 
Microsoft 365 provides a service that allows you to assign and manage tasks by using task cards. You can easily manage tasks across Microsoft 365 and access and update your tasks as you work, no matter which app you’re using. You can see your tasks across your lists as you move between apps and devices. You can also view all your tasks from Microsoft To Do and Microsoft Planner with Tasks in Microsoft Teams.

Since the last item is talking about a service that allows "you" to plan, proritize and manage resources... so if assuming that this is just some personal task management, Microsoft To Do might be a better option.


Microsoft To Do and Microsoft Project are both task management applications, but they have different strengths and weaknesses.

Microsoft To Do is a lightweight task management app that is designed to be simple and easy to use. It is a good option for individuals or small teams who need a basic task management tool.
Microsoft TO DO is the WRONG answer

Bookings
Planner
Projects
https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/project/project-plan-3?activetab=pivot:overviewtab
MS Project Online: Assign resources with resource management capabilities.
Is the last question clearly To-Do, which is for yourself, rather than Project, which is managing others?

You need to recommend the appropriate Microsoft 365 services.

Which services should you recommend? To answer, drag the appropriate services to the correct features. Each service may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.


NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

A company is evaluating the capabilities of Windows 365 and Azure Virtual Desktop.

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Sorry typo on my end the correct answers are NO for M365 and intune licenses
NO for windows 365 using multi-session 
YES for fslogic and AVD

comments.content:
https://getnerdio.com/resources/windows-365-vs-azure-virtual-desktop-avd-comparing-two-daas-products/
Azure Virtual Desktop supports all current versions of Windows, including Windows 10 Enterprise (single session), EVD (multi-session) and Server 2012/2016/2019.

Windows 365 cloud PCs only support Windows 10 Enterprise (single session) since they are dedicated, non-multi-user desktops.

discussion.content:
1. Yes, 
You need Microsoft Intune license to use Windows 365 both enterprise and frontliner version. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-365/enterprise/requirements?tabs=enterprise%2Cent#licensing-requirements

2. No, 
Windows 365 don't use multi session Windows OS
https://getnerdio.com/resources/windows-365-vs-azure-virtual-desktop-avd-comparing-two-daas-products/

3. Yes, 
Azure Virtual Desktop use FSLogix container to store user profile data
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/fslogix-profile-containers

Users must have a Microsoft Intune license to use Windows 365.

 No
 While Intune can be used to manage Windows 365 devices, it is not a mandatory requirement. Windows 365 can be managed through other methods as well.

Windows 365 uses a multi-session Windows operating system.

 No
 Windows 365 is designed for single-session use, providing each user with a dedicated Windows instance. Multi-session capabilities are a feature of Azure Virtual Desktop.

Azure Virtual Desktop uses a FSLogix container to store user profile data.

 Yes
 Azure Virtual Desktop utilizes FSLogix technology to manage and store user profiles in containers, allowing for faster logins and a consistent user experience across sessions.

This is clearly an old question when Enterprise was not yet around, we must assume basic WIndows 365. For me N N Y if based on Windows 365 for Business. Windows 365 is not multi session in either version.

This is an old question.

Windows 365 Business does not require Intune Licence, W365 Enterprise does.
MS has since released W365 Enterprise Multi-session PCs, but you cannot upgrade old Business or Enterprise PCs to Multi-session.

Y N Y
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-365/enterprise/requirements?tabs=enterprise%2Cent

Azure Virtual Desktop supports all current versions of Windows, including Windows 10 Enterprise (single session), EVD (multi-session) and Server 2012/2016/2019.

Windows 365 cloud PCs only support Windows 10 Enterprise (single session) since they are dedicated, non-multi-user desktops.
